alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Valley; Eastern Roosevelt; McCone; Richland; Western Roosevelt (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:43PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Roosevelt, southeastern Valley, northeastern McCone and northwestern Richland Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 443 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles southwest of Bredette to near Wolf Point. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wolf Point, Poplar, Vida and Sprole. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Montana.
